name: The Islander
desc:
An old man by a <input type="text" value="" data-result="seashore" />
At the end of <input type="text" value="" data-result="day" />
Gazes the <input type="text" value="" data-result="horizon" />
With seawinds in his face
Tempest-tossed island
<input type="text" value="" data-result="Seasons" /> all the same
Anchorage unpainted
And a ship without a <input type="text" value="" data-result="name" />

Sea without a <input type="text" value="" data-result="shore" /> for the banished one unheard
He lightens the beacon, light at the end of <input type="text" value="" data-result="world" />
Showing the way lighting <input type="text" value="" data-result="hope" /> in their hearts
The ones on their <input type="text" value="" data-result="travels" /> homeward from afar

This is for long-forgotten
Light at the end of the <input type="text" value="" data-result="world" />
Horizon <input type="text" value="" data-result="crying" />
The tears he left <input type="text" value="" data-result="behind" /> long ago

The albatross is <input type="text" value="" data-result="flying" />
Making him daydream
The time before he <input type="text" value="" data-result="became" />
One of the world`s unseen
Princess in the <input type="text" value="" data-result="tower" />
Children in the fields
Life <input type="text" value="" data-result="gave" /> him it all:
An island of the <input type="text" value="" data-result="universe" />

Now his love's a memory
A <input type="text" value="" data-result="ghost" /> in the fog
He sets the sails one last <input type="text" value="" data-result="time" />
Saying farewell to the world
Anchor to the <input type="text" value="" data-result="water" />
Seabed far below
Grass still in his <input type="text" value="" data-result="feet" />
And a smile <input type="text" value="" data-result="beneath" /> his brow

[...]
